main event: On August 25, 1958, in Spring Lake, Michigan, a yellow object the size of a baseball was observed traveling in a straight path and then disappearing suddenly within a duration of 30 seconds.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 30 seconds and involved the observation of a single yellow object, the size of a baseball, moving in a straight path before disappearing abruptly.
The observer was a 35-year-old housewife from Spring Lake, adding credibility to the witness.
The report indicates that there were no photographs available to document the sighting.
The observation occurred at night at 2239 GMT.
The report was submitted to Project Blue Book, a program dedicated to the study of UFO sightings.
Although there were no photos and only a brief description, the observation was taken seriously and recorded for further evaluation by the military personnel.
sighted object: a single yellow object the size of a baseball
